item.title: "for … in" vs "for … of" in JavaScript
item.description: TIL that for … in and for … of have different behaviors in JavaScript. As a native Python developer, I had presumed that for … in in JavaScript would have a similar behavior to the equivalent in Python. However, they have very different behaviors. See below: TLDR JavaScript Python for (foo in []) for i in range([]) for (foo of []) for i in [] Details for … in iterates over the keys of a particular object, whereas for … of iterates over the values of the object.
